intro: Grewiella dewevrei, commonly known as the dewevrei gourd, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, squash, and gourds. The plant produces large, inflated fruits that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, with a rough texture. The flowers are typically yellow and solitary, appearing at the base of the stems.
